episodeTitle: An All-Consuming Inferno!! Admiral Akainu's Power!
episodeTitleJapanese: すべてを焼き尽くす！ 大将赤犬の能力
episodeTitleRomanized: Subete o Yakitsukusu! Taishō Akainu no Chikara
description: During the Battle of Marineford, the Whitebeard Pirates' commanders showcase their abilities against the Marines. Admiral Akainu reveals his devastating magma powers for the first time by destroying a massive ice block thrown by Diamond Jozu. As volcanic meteors rain down on the battlefield, Little Oars Jr. arrives to join the fight.

events.title: Whitebeard Pirates Commanders Showcase Abilities
events.description: The various division commanders of the Whitebeard Pirates demonstrate their combat skills and Devil Fruit abilities as the battle intensifies. The commanders lead their forces in a full charge against the Marines.
events.significance: Establishes the strength and capabilities of Whitebeard's top commanders, showing they can match the Marine forces in combat.

events.title: Kizaru's Yasakani no Magatama Attack
events.description: Admiral Kizaru crosses his arms and fires a devastating torrent of light particles at Whitebeard from above, using his Yasakani no Magatama technique.
events.significance: Demonstrates one of Admiral Kizaru's most powerful Pika Pika no Mi techniques during a direct assault on Whitebeard.

quotes.speaker: Kizaru
quotes.context: Kizaru unleashes his light particle attack on Whitebeard

events.title: Marco Blocks Kizaru with Fujiazami
events.description: Marco transforms into his phoenix form and intercepts Kizaru's Yasakani no Magatama attack, protecting Whitebeard. He uses his Fujiazami technique to ward off the admiral's assault.
events.significance: First demonstration of Marco's defensive capabilities with his Mythical Zoan phoenix powers, showing he can block even an admiral's attack.

events.title: Jozu Hurls Massive Ice Block
events.description: Diamond Jozu orders his crew to clear the area, then breaks through the ice floor and lifts a colossal iceberg approximately ten times larger than the Marine giants. He hurls this massive ice block toward the admirals and Marine forces.
events.significance: Demonstrates Jozu's incredible physical strength and sets up the reveal of Akainu's Devil Fruit powers. The broken ice later allows Luffy's group to arrive safely.

events.title: Akainu Reveals Magma Powers
events.description: Admiral Akainu stands from his seat for the first time and reveals his Devil Fruit ability, the Magu Magu no Mi, which allows him to create and control magma. This is the first time his magma powers are shown in the series.
events.significance: Major reveal of one of the most powerful Devil Fruits in the series. Akainu's magma abilities will play a crucial role in the war's outcome and future events.

events.title: Akainu's Dai Funka Destroys Ice Block
events.description: Akainu uses his signature technique Dai Funka (Great Eruption), transforming his fist into pure magma and launching it forward like an oversized rocket. The attack instantly evaporates Jozu's massive ice block with minimal effort.
events.significance: First use of Akainu's most powerful technique, demonstrating the overwhelming destructive power of the Magu Magu no Mi and shocking both allies and enemies.

quotes.speaker: Akainu
quotes.context: Akainu unleashes his magma fist to destroy the ice block

events.title: Akainu's Meteor Shower Ignites the Battlefield
events.description: After destroying the ice block, Akainu's magma attack creates a massive meteor shower of volcanic rocks that rain down on the battlefield, setting it ablaze. The flaming projectiles crash down on the Whitebeard Pirates, destroying one of their ships and creating widespread panic.
events.significance: Demonstrates the area-of-effect devastation of Akainu's powers. The attack terrorizes observers at Sabaody Archipelago and establishes Akainu as a major threat.

events.title: Whitebeard Blocks Volcanic Meteors
events.description: As volcanic meteors rain down toward him, Whitebeard calmly uses his bisento to deflect the attacks, showing that Akainu's assault has no effect on him.
events.significance: Demonstrates Whitebeard's composure and combat skill even against admiral-level attacks, maintaining his status as the strongest man in the world.

events.title: Koby and Helmeppo Question Their Worth
events.description: Koby and Helmeppo, witnessing the overwhelming power of the admirals and top fighters, question their own worth and abilities in this massive battle. They wonder if they can make any difference in such a conflict.
events.significance: Character development moment for Koby and Helmeppo, highlighting the vast power gap and their feelings of inadequacy. This is anime-original content not present in the manga.

events.title: Little Oars Jr. Arrives at Marineford
events.description: Little Oars Jr., a massive giant standing approximately 60 meters tall and descendant of the legendary Oars, arrives at the battlefield. He towers over the Marine forces and declares his intention to save Ace.
events.significance: Debut of Little Oars Jr., establishing him as a powerful ally of the Whitebeard Pirates. His arrival adds a new dimension to the battle and sets up his confrontation with the Warlords.

quotes.speaker: Little Oars Jr.
quotes.context: Little Oars Jr.'s declaration upon arriving at Marineford

events.title: Little Oars Jr. Destroys Marine Ship
events.description: Little Oars Jr. demonstrates his immense power by slashing through and destroying one of the Marine battleships with ease, showcasing his combat capabilities and commitment to the rescue mission.
events.significance: Establishes Little Oars Jr. as a formidable force in the battle and shows his determination to fight for Ace's freedom.

quotes.speaker: Kizaru
quotes.context: Kizaru attacks Whitebeard with light particles

quotes.speaker: Akainu
quotes.context: Akainu destroys the ice block with his magma fist

quotes.speaker: Little Oars Jr.
quotes.context: Little Oars Jr. declares his purpose upon arriving

themes.description: The episode showcases the devastating power of the Marine admirals, particularly Akainu, whose magma abilities create widespread destruction and terror.
themes.symbolism: The volcanic meteor shower represents the Marines' overwhelming military might and the seemingly insurmountable challenge facing the Whitebeard Pirates.

themes.description: Little Oars Jr.'s arrival demonstrates the deep bonds between Ace and his allies, with the giant willing to risk his life for his friend.
themes.symbolism: Little Oars Jr.'s massive size represents the magnitude of loyalty and friendship in One Piece.

themes.description: Koby and Helmeppo's questioning of their worth contrasts with the determination of fighters like Little Oars Jr., showing different responses to overwhelming odds.
themes.symbolism: The contrast between the small Marines and the giant combatants represents feelings of powerlessness.

characterSpotlights.development: Akainu's Devil Fruit powers are revealed for the first time, establishing him as one of the most dangerous threats in the war. His ruthless efficiency and overwhelming destructive capability are on full display.
keyActions: Stands from his seat to confront the ice block
Reveals Magu Magu no Mi powers
Uses Dai Funka to destroy the ice block
Creates volcanic meteor shower that ignites the battlefield

characterSpotlights.development: Little Oars Jr. makes his debut as a powerful giant willing to risk everything to save Ace, demonstrating the reach of Ace's friendships and the Whitebeard Pirates' influence.
Jozu demonstrates his incredible physical strength by throwing a massive iceberg, though his attack inadvertently allows Akainu to showcase his superior Devil Fruit powers.
keyActions: Lifts and throws massive ice block

characterSpotlights.development: Marco continues to serve as Whitebeard's primary defender, using his phoenix abilities to block Kizaru's attacks and protect his captain.
keyActions: Blocks Kizaru's Yasakani no Magatama with Fujiazami

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime added a scene of Koby and Helmeppo questioning their worth in battle, which was not present in the manga.
Features a Pandaman appearance in the background as an Easter egg not present in the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first time Akainu's Devil Fruit powers are shown in the anime, though the name 'Magu Magu no Mi' is not revealed until later.
Little Oars Jr. is approximately 60 meters tall, roughly three times the size of a normal giant.

sources.title: Little Oars Jr. - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This episode received a 9.2 rating on IMDb, making it one of the highest-rated episodes of the Marineford arc.
The opening song 'One day' by The ROOTLESS has a more somber tone compared to previous openings, reflecting the serious events of the Marineford Arc.
Episode 463 aired during a period when One Piece did not have ending theme songs (from Episode 279 to Episode 1070).

sources.title: One Piece Music - One Piece Wiki
